title: The Evolution of Money
narrative_overlay: From primitive commodity to proof-of-work: the full arc of monetary history. Each stage set the stage for the next—until Bitcoin.

title: Hard vs. Easy Money
narrative_overlay: True wealth is scarce. Bitcoin and gold sit on one end; fiat and easily replicated commodities on the other. Know where you stand.

title: Salability Across Distance and Time
narrative_overlay: The extent to which something can be easily sold. Bitcoin dominates the upper-right: high salability across both distance and time.

title: Deconstructing the White Paper
narrative_overlay: Digital signatures, proof of work, Merkle trees—the white paper in one map. Every concept links to the document that started it all.

title: Systems of Measurement
narrative_overlay: Weight, temperature, energy, distance, time. And value. Bitcoin is the system of measurement for value in the digital age.

title: Global Reserve Currencies
narrative_overlay: Empires rise and fall. So do their currencies. The timeline of reserve dominance—and who might be next.

title: How Inflation Impacts Savings
narrative_overlay: Those percentages aren't growth. They're the rate at which your savings are being debased. Silence is the strategy.

title: Fiat Economy vs. Bitcoin Economy
narrative_overlay: More paper, fewer assets—or fewer units, more assets. The two economies could not be more different.

title: The Fifth Layer
narrative_overlay: Above application, transport, internet, and link: the value transfer layer. Bitcoin allocates scarce resources across networks.

title: $100B+ Dominant Digital Networks
narrative_overlay: Social, mobile, retail, speech, information, video—and monetary. Bitcoin belongs in the same sentence.

title: The Evolution of Accounting
narrative_overlay: Single-entry, double-entry, triple-entry. From clay tablets to an independently verifiable chain of digital signatures. 2008.

title: Digital Duplication to Digital Scarcity
narrative_overlay: 1948: digital meant infinite copies. 2009: Bitcoin introduced mathematical scarcity to the digital realm.

title: How Bitcoin Grows
narrative_overlay: Drain monetary premiums. Replace cash and bonds in portfolios. Re-denominate business models. Bitcoin takes a slice from many pies.

title: Gold Standard to Bitcoin Standard
narrative_overlay: Past: gold-backed discipline. Future: programmable, verifiable scarcity. The transition is underway.

title: Mechanics of the Protocol
narrative_overlay: Proof of work. Fixed supply. Difficulty adjustment. Halving. Decentralized. Immutable. The machine in one view.

title: The Halving Impact
narrative_overlay: Block subsidy halves. Supply tightens. Every four years the protocol reminds the world: scarcity is non-negotiable.

title: Network Participants
narrative_overlay: Nodes, miners, users. A distributed system with no single point of failure. The machine runs without permission.

title: Monetary Sovereignty and Energy
narrative_overlay: Mining gives billions a path to monetary sovereignty. The same energy that powers the grid can secure the ledger.

title: Software Eats the World
narrative_overlay: 2010s: software ate consumer goods. 2020s: software is eating monetary premiums. Banks, gold, real estate, fiat—all on the menu.

title: Transacting Bitcoin Offline
narrative_overlay: Satellite. Shortwave. SMS. Mesh networks. Bearer instruments. Sovereignty doesn't require a constant connection.

title: Amara's Law
narrative_overlay: We overestimate short-term impact and underestimate long-term impact. Bitcoin is the long game.

title: Bitcoin Supply Formula
narrative_overlay: Σ 210,000 × (50/2^i). The total supply is knowable, verifiable, and capped. No committee can change it.

title: Monetary History Meets Digital Networks
narrative_overlay: Understanding Bitcoin requires both: monetary history and digital networks. The Venn diagram of sovereign literacy.

title: Bitcoin Categorization
narrative_overlay: Store of value. Medium of exchange. Unit of account. And: network, protocol, software, technology. Bitcoin is all of it.

title: Generational Shift
narrative_overlay: Boomers to Gen B. Each cohort faces a different monetary reality. The next one grows up with sound money as an option.

title: Satoshi's Legacy
narrative_overlay: Rockefeller. Carnegie. Vanderbilt. Ford. Edison. Satoshi. One name created a system that doesn't require their kind of empire.

title: Bitcoin vs. Fiat as Measurement
narrative_overlay: Two rulers. One inflates. One doesn't. What you measure with determines what you build.

title: Policy and Distribution
narrative_overlay: The map of who holds what—and who decides. Bitcoin changes the distribution of monetary sovereignty.

title: The Pulse of Freedom
narrative_overlay: Self-custody. Circular economy. The Bitcoin standard. Not a prediction—a possibility you can opt into today.

title: Value-for-Value
narrative_overlay: This intelligence is free because sovereignty is a human right. If it provided value, support the mission. Keep the signal strong.

title: Sovereign Grade
narrative_overlay: You've completed the dossier. Take the Sovereignty Check. Then choose: donate, share, and act.

title: Decentralized. Open. Yours.
narrative_overlay: No gatekeeper. No permission. The protocol runs. The rest is up to you.
